column4: Ok, I'm back.  But my card still isn't installed... Not sure where I went wrong.
the problem is you tried to setup nvidia drivers and now cant get into the gui right?
Actually, I got Xserver back online using "sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg".  Now xserver is working but I still don't have my nvidia card enables...
youre using a i686 or 386 kernel right?
Yep.  And it's an older nvidia, so it should be the legacy package...
I;m working from the man at https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/Nvidia
First step being "sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-legacy"  which I've done and just rechecked...
ok sudo apt-get install linux-restricted-modules-`uname -r` just copy that and paste into a terminal
Also installed nvidia-glx-dev because I wasn't sure if it was the same as 3d grapicks acceleration (reasonably certina it's not, but..)
Ok, wait uninstalled the dev package, not what I needed.
you can remove the dev package or leave it however you like
Ok, input what you said to... No errors returned..
lets try sudo nvidia-glx-config enable again and then alt-ctrl-backspace
what were looking for is that pretty nvidia logo when it starts back up
Yeah, I did this before I reinstalled last night.  Worked fine. got the logo, all was well.  About to restart Xserver, brb.
